Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MildaKorsakaite
Reviews.Content: The staff tried to put us in an office looking building when we first arrived. After much protest, they put us in the main building. It was cute, not average. The AC was loud at night but the location was generally good. There is an amazing restaurant within the hotel, the cheese fondue there is the best I have ever had and I definitely have had my fair share of cheese fondue in many different countries!

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good”
Reviews.Author: johannasalla
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, not great, not poor. We stayed 2 weeks in Jan12 in a family room. Family room was strange since this was 2 bedrooms with 2 gueen size beds, and a narrow entrance room with a sofa. In this room there was no air condition so no-one can sleep there. No service at the pool, Pool was quite cold (no heatind). At the Beach Club if you are not All Inclusive Customer, you can't buy anything from the club, not with money. We took only breakfast. No telephones, no room service. Breakfast at the Ceiba was ok. Room was clean and towels were nicely wrapped to different forms.

Reviews.Title: “Look Else Where”
Reviews.Author: Bucky_Badger51
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money, I would have given this resort an average rating if I had not gotten sick! Food is not very good, often served cold. Pools are small, dirty and also cold. They do over book, and it also seemed to me they are in dire need of new management.

Reviews.Title: “this is not all inclusive far from it !!”
Reviews.Author: bruce k
Reviews.Content: stay away if you think this is an all inclusive, you have to walk across the road for anything , no service at the pool and it is tiny and cold, you cannot even get water at the pool never mind a drink .the food is awfully. and no fridges in the room, no water nothing Be prepared not to stay there they over book all the time and move you across the road.or to the another hotel It had location but that is all .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: Dirk0602
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent one week at El Tukan and went for the breakfast option, which in our opinion suited our needs just fine. We arrived a bit early on check-in day- the check-in time is 3pm and they adhere to it. Although we had booked with El Tukan, they showed us a room at Moongate Hotel (a property beloning to El Tukan just across the street). We weren't happy at all with the room (very small, just one double bed, window directly to noisy 5ta Avenida, moldy smell in the bathroom) and asked for a different room. This one actually was at El Tukan, with two double beds, a balcony with view to the pool and a decent bathroom. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at El Tukan; the breakfast buffet at El Ceiba restaurant across the road was more than adaquate, with fruits, yogurts, omelettes made to order and other breakfast items changing on a daily basis. The staff were friendly and efficient, rooms were made up everyday and towels changed. We didn't use the pool or jacuzzi, as the water there was a bit too cold for our liking. Included in the stay is access to the hotel's beach club, which is a couple of blocks away. There is a shuttle, however we enjoyed walking the short distance every day. We couldn't get any drinks from the beach club's bar, as we didn't have the all-inclusive bracelet, but the friendly waiters from neighbouring Kool Beach Club will get you anything you like. All- in-all, we can highly recommend El Tukan, however make sure you get a room in the main property, not at Moongate. We think it is good value for money and if you like to eat out at different places, the breakfast will be perfect for you. Playa has a wide variety of different places to eat out at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “A Centrally located piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: BubblyCCChampagne
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks, over Christmas and New Year's in Playa, staying at El Tukan. My very first impression was that it was kind of sparse, but then again I didn't go on holiday to stay in my room. Through the upcoming weeks I was impressed by the efficiency with which the hotel was run, the gorgeously delicious breakfast buffets, the cleanliness of the room and the reasonable speed with which any help needed at reception was given. After all, you are in Mexico so don't expect everyone to speak English! *smile* My only two issues with El Tukan were that the beach-club was kind of far away (and - during this period of time - extremely noisy with the bpm festival) and that I couldn't get any recommendations of where to go to taste (and learn about) tequila. A word of warning about hard beds, but over all my dream holiday really became my dream holiday, staying at El Tukan (and I know I sound like someone paid me to say that! *blushing*).Apart from that I only have good things to say about this hotel and the staff I met there. I hope to be able to return again one day!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aidan M
Reviews.Content: El Tukan is located right on the main tourist shopping street. However, you cannot even tell such a busy place was near there. Huge trees shadowed out the streets making it look like you were in a dense tropical rainforest. It included a pool (although it was always freezing, it was very shallow). The breakfast buffet was delicious, and you didn't have to walk far to reach the beach area. My only complaints were that there was no internet connection at all, and because of the freezing cold "hot" tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great room”
Reviews.Author: Tiina L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in El Tukan for 10 days in November 2011. We chose El Tukan because of the central location and rather good reviews. The location of the hotel is great, but the location of our room was not. We got a room in another building on another street. The room was on the ground floor, facing the side street. The electrical fence didn`t bother me but the noise from some kind of water system thing right next to the room was a source of trouble. A pump was pounding against the wall all night long and the sleep quality was extremely poor. If you would get a better room, the hotel is fine because of the great location and a very good beach. But you would have to find it first! But when you are there, it is a good place with good service. I can also recommend the Sports Bar across the street from our building for a good food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Gerben V
Reviews.Content: We went for 2 weeks the hotel is on the 5 avenu ant thats realy nice, by the beach is a small bar and seats, perfect place for a relaxing hollyday, rooms are very clean only in the mornings we experienced that the watersupply wasn.t enough

Reviews.Title: “Last-minute pick, worked out fine.”
Reviews.Author: bjc2150
Reviews.Content: Our original super-cheap hotel cancelled on us due to the impending Hurricane Rina, so we had to find one through the help of Best Day travel, the intermediary on our Expedia trip. It was the nicest of the three that had meal-plan/drink options. We originally planned for just breakfast, but we decided on the "all inclusive" red wristband deal, which was a bargain. $20 per person per day. Unlimited food at the three sittings, which was essentially all day. Basic drinks included (national liquor, beer & wine brands). All of this is in the restaurant across the street, which is very plain, but nice, and all of it was buffet, which ranged from very good to fair. Never went away hungry. Drinks were a bit light, but you just ask for double shots in them. Beer and wine is basic, but works. So, obviously not a high-end destination, but perfect for a scrappy no-nonsense vacation in the heart of everything. The rooms are basic in furnishings & amenities (for Mexico). The pool photo is accurate, and the center of all the rooms, representative of the feel of the place. The pool and jacuzzi are NOT heated, though! There is a restaurant and bar much nicer on the front, but there is a more expensive all-inclusive required for that, which allows you to eat/drink there and at other sister-hotels/restaurants. The beach club/bar is included in the red wristband deal, and made all the difference. It is about six blocks away, and offers nice lounge chairs, towels, and the same type drinks. There was a group of Florida girls we saw each day who easily got very drunk! (Good people-watching.) Surprisingly, there were other gay couples in the area which we did not expect. So much less an issue there - no one cares. Hell, we could've got married there if we wanted to. A couple issues that were problematic turned out to be not the hotel's fault. When a hurricane is approaching the town shuts down liquor across the board - nowhere for 18 hours! (Gasp!) I complained enough for a reduction in our plan cost and a second night eating at the nice restaurant (one is included already with the red plan.) Storm was windy, but not damaging after all. The second is the WiFi, which was maddening. Turns out we could not get a good enough signal anywhere except Starbucks, but still could not connect. This was especially odd because we had perfect WiFi service in the jungles of Costa Rica? Anyway, not really Tukan’s fault. Beware roaming too. Tours are available in the lobby, and were cheaper than at the source when on the all inclusive. Almost half the price for Chichen Itza, and 2/3rds for the Coba Extreme. “Extreme” is medium to mild, btw. Lobby is not “indoors”, nor is restaurant and bar. All covered, but if a storm is near, it gets wet. Missed that there was a small cenote on the small property, but weren’t allowed down anyway. It was weirdly tucked behind the restaurant kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Club.... Not so great on the rest”
Reviews.Author: reegsi
Reviews.Content: I visit Playa Del Carmen often. I have stayed at a variety of hotels and condos in the area. My friends and I were coming from different cities and wanted a cheap all inclusive in the downtown area. We narrowed our choices down to the Tukan and the Real. We decided on the Tukan based on a post from the hotel manager on trip advisor stating that guests were allowed to visit but that over night guests were required to pay 170 pesos. Our first night there a friend came to visit and was told to leave. The staff working was very rude. I explained to them what was posted on the website and that we had visited friends at that hotel before. Also one of the girls staying with us was arriving a day late due to her flight being cancelled. I asked if he could just take her all inclusive bracelet as we had paid for it and no name was assigned to it and we were told NO! In the end I paid the 170 pesos so that he could come and hang out in our room until we went out for the night. I was very angry with the attitude of the front desk staff. They were rude about the issue and dismissive. We had some other issues with staff and our room. Our room was really musty even for Playa. The room was not set up as we had expected. We asked for our room to be cleaned 3 times before someone came. We also reserved our rooms from the hotel website and then were told a different price when we arrived and the front desk said it was with tax… but we explained our final price did include tax. To be fair we were familiar with the hotel and did not expect an amazing buffet or amenities. We bought all inclusive mainly for the drinks at the beach club. The staff at the beach club were awesome! But in the end the buffet wasn’t all that bad. The breakfast options were pretty good and the other meals were pretty basic. It was nice that the buffet kind of kept it more local than most all inclusives and actually had hot habanero sauce :) The hotel is in a great location and has a great beach club. We defiantly drank enough at the beach club to cover the costs of the all inclusive option but the service at the front desk will make me think twice before recommending this hotel or going back myself.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but if u have all inclusive for 50 us pp u get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: Spinniecur
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms are ok, service is pleasant but go only for the breakfast not for the all-inclusive. The breakfast is great, the lunch is ok but dinner isn't. The bar from the all-inclusive restaurant is, comparing to the nice bars and cafes of playa del carmen, not worth a visit. By the way the all-inclusive deal I booked on bookit.com allowed me one dinner at a nearby restaurant, not the all-inclusive one. But I had to bargain for it because at reception they told me I could only go there if I stayed for 7 nights. I had to show the the voucher and everything to convince them otherwise. The beachclub who is part of the all-inclusive deal is not worth a visit either, there are much better beachclubs like Mamita's on calle 28 But overall don't understand me wrong, it was a great place to stay but for 50 us dollars a person the all-inclusive is not worth it. I understand because 50 us dollars is nothing for an all-inclusive resort, especially when u keep in mind it is inclusive the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value; Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: scuba_gramps
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at El Tukan twice now: May 2010 and again this May 2011. Both times I had it booked for me by Tank-Ha, the dive shop I go with in PDC. I had read reviews of some people having problems being placed in one of their other properties (other "boutique" hotels in the area), or otherwise not getting what they expected, but we never had that problem at all. We were there a full two weeks this time, and also booked a room for friends for the first 5 days. We had rooms facing the pool; ours on the ground floor (easy walk out to the gardens/pool) and our friend's on the second floor. We booked the "European Plan", breakfast included, which we ate at their restaurant across the street. This is one of many "budget" hotels, but generally very clean, and certainly a convenient location. PROS: Good location, good value, clean, nice little pool area, free WiFi. CONS: Simple rooms, no ice*/fridge. The pool is small, but a nice little area. If you have a room on the ground floor facing the pool, it's literally a few steps from your garden door. 5th Ave is right outside. They are associated with a property on the beach; you can take their shuttle over there - we always walked (~.8km?). The breakfast buffet was fairly good. Not the selection you find it a large all-inclusive, but sufficient. The rooms are clean but simple (no phone, no fridge, no clock). You could get a glass or two of ice from the living bar, but if you want enough to keep drinks cold, you need to go out a few blocks on 10th Ave. to a convenience store (20 - 24 Pesos/basso). The air conditioners were effective, but since they were in-room, caused some noise, but not hard to get used to. The staff was friendly and generally helpful, as much as they could be. Example: the lounge chair on our deck broke the second day. Although we told the front desk (and I did say it wasn't urgent) it wasn't fixed when we checked out 2 weeks later. Our in-room water heater started to leak the second week. Although we were told someone would be in to change it the next day, it also wasn't changed when we checked out about 4 days later (but they changed the towels on the floor each day). On the other hand, I reported WiFi failure twice, and on both occasions, the desk made a call and a "guy" showed up and either rebooted the gateway and even climbed a pole to smack the antenna :) By the way, the WiFi coverage improved a to from 2010 to 2011; I had good coverage even in my room this year. I can't be too critical of their maintenance - it's Mexico (and I don't mean that negatively); if it's REALLY critical, they'll take care of it somehow; if it's not, live with it. One last comment about the garden area: 3 years ago we stayed at the Vista Caribe, 4th St., and although it was very close to the pubic beach, had a fridge, clock, phone, lots of room, we went back to the El Tukan this year mostly because my wife really enjoyed the pool/garden area, right out our back door, while I was away diving.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: ninitochka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Tukan for 5 das in August 2011. I have had stayed in a few hotels in the area before and El Tukan is about average in comparison. I have received a good deal for the "room only" plan (under 50/night) and it was worth the price. If I would've had to pay full price - I think I would be dissapointed. There is AC and fan in the room but no telephone. Bathrooms are very basic and the layout of the room was weird too but with a lot of closet space. The staff was polite and helpful but nobody would go an extra mile to assist. I am glad I did not get an all-inclusive plan because the food at their restaurants was average/below avergae and there are much better food/service options all over 5a Avenida. Beach club (Kool) is about 10 minutes away from the hotel and if you don't get all-inclusive option , you can use the chairs and umbrellasbut can not buy food/drinks - have to walk to a different becach clud, which is a bit odd. Plan to get to the beach early in the morning otherwise there will not be any chairs available.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst place I have EVER stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: cheekyprincess007
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Playa for the past 9 years and have stayed a variety of hotel in Playa and this was by far the worst place I have ever stayed ANYWHERE!!!! First off, we booked back in March and was given a description on the room that we would be getting. Which was nothing like we got. I know that things happen, but . . . . . We get there and they escort us to our room that was a block away the room was nice and modern, then they show us our first floor patio and we sere surrounded by an electric fence!!!!! Now I know Playa and this was just upsetting! We ask to have a different room that did not make us feel like we were in some kind of jail on our vacation and they said they were booked but would see what they could do. So they bring us back over the the main area of the hotel - which is the older section. They say that they have a suite available but it would cost an extra $20 a night. We agree to look at it. Walking there, it dropped to an additional $10 a night. We walk in and the room is right off the pool and no electric fence in sight, but the room is very well worn and dated and no way considered a suite. As we stand there deciding between the better of the 2 rooms, they tell us we could have if for $50 more for the week. So we take it, at least the electric fence was gone. On the positive side the room was very clean. One day they did not even bother to clean our room???? One day they only left one towel??? On our second day there, as we were getting ready for the beach, a HUGE cockroach ran across the floor and under the bed! You can call them waterbugs if that makes you feel better, but they are cockroaches. As we attempt to leave the room to notify the front desk, we open the door to be greeted by 100s of cockroaches running for their lives - large and small. The management decided to exterminate. To make things more interesting is that the iguanas were having a field day with all the roaches running around. How about a little notice. The grounds keepers thought is was funny as I ran screaming to the front desk because there were soooo many roaches running they were running across my feet!!!! One evening we went to exchange our beach towels for the next day. We had used them for 3 days and thought it would nice to have fresh ones. The man at the front desk told us to bring them by in the morning and exchange them then. So we come by the next morning and the new guy at the front desk started yelling at us and refusing to give us clean towels!!! Refusing!!! How do you refuse to give a clean towel, we were not asking for them daily. Needless to say, I stood my ground until we got clean ones. Then the food!!!! Other than the breakfast, which is hard to screw up, I would not feed their food to my dog!!!! Almost everyday, breakfast through dinner, they served hot dogs!!!! They put hot dogs in everything. I do know that this was not one of those high end all -inclusives, but give me a break. Other than breakfast, we NEVER ate there, it was terrible. One night we did get to eat with the people who spent more and that food was excellent! I just can't believe they get away with serving such a low standard of food to their other customers! The only enjoyable part of the stay was the beach club. They share space with the KOOL beach club and they have a great pool right on the beach. The beach bar that the Tukan is very small and offers only low end beer and drinks, but at least there is a place to lay at the ocean. The bar staff was always more than friendly. Needless to say, we will NEVER stay here again and will tell everyone to NEVER stay there. Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zvekikreki
Reviews.Content: Hello everybody, I am writing this review in order to help people make the right decision when opting for this hotel! let me start of by saying that we have traveled A LOT, we travel 3-4 times a year and we are in our late 20s and early 30s. So we know what we are talking about!We have done it all- 5 star hotels, 3 star hotels, all inclusives, backpacking,european plans, 4 crusies-we have tried it all! and...we loved El Tukan! 1. If you like the comfort of fancy all inclusive quiet resorts-this is NOT the place for you! this is a very cool hotel, with a lot of vegetation and with an AH-MAZING location- close to the beach, night life,restaurants and even to big supermarkets like Walmart and mega! seriously it has it all. If you like to party and have a good time and like the fact you don't need a taxi for ANYTHING, then this is the place for you. ROOMS: For a 3 star hotel this place is amazingly clean!We were seriously impressed!The rooms as well as the hotel grounds are impeccably clean!Keep up the good work!The rooms are very basic but very cute.Lots of closet space. yes, the rooms may be a bit louder (but only until midnight) if you are facing the street, but if you have a room facing the pool-no problem at all. BEDS: we had a queen size bed and it was huge, yes it was a bit hard but nothing you couldn't get used to. AIR-CONDITIONING: yes the air conditioning was a bit loud, but here is the catch!When you leave the room set the temperature to 20 degrees Celsius or so, that will cool off the room really nicely! then at night, when you are about to go to sleep, set the air conditioning to 25-26 degrees and the room will remain cool but the system would work for a minute or 2 and then go on stand by for 30 mins or so.This way you can sleep with no noise and still enjoy the freshness. During the day the noise didn't bother us at all. THE FOOD: we only had breakfast included and we must say it was pretty repetitive and not too much choice...but it was DELICIOUS!go to the omelet station and you can ask for any type of eggs or even better, ask for freshly made quesadillas with your choice of ham or chorizo, or both-amazing!some days food was better than others.they had pancakes, french toast, grilled ham and cheese sandwiches,empanadas,tacos dorados and a lot of delish fresh pastries and fruits.No cold cuts and cheeses though. for lunch and dinned there were soooo many restaurants around and really cheap too, we had no problems finding good food. THE BEACH: is breath taking. white sand and turquoise water. the beach club is great, with a huuuuge clean washroom and shower, and the best thing for us- at noon the DJ starts playing house music at the Kool beach club(which is adjacent to the el tukan beach club).the beach is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, and a very pleasant walk indeed. LOCATION: the best location ever!we never needed a taxi not even once!we walked to all the restaurants and bars , we walked to Walmart and mega, we walked to the playa del carmen port!If you want all the action close to you-this is the place! STAFF: was very friendly and nice.we had a few problems with our room keys(they got demagnetized) and our shower wasn't working one day but they fixed the problems pretty fast. NIGHT LIFE: i must say that this is a perfect hotel for party people. the hotel itself is quiet but the fun is just 2 blocks away! all the best clubs are literally 2 blocks away on 5th avenue and 12th street (the hotel is on 5ht av and 14th street). the clubs are amazing, from Mandala, to Blue Parrot to Pink Elephant and Coco Bongo. The fifth av restaurants and bars die off after midnight and then the party continues on the 12th street. Hope this review helps and we hope you have an amazing trip like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: williamj38
Reviews.Content: We booked with Tukan over Hotels.com. They claimed we would have a 2 room suite with a living room and 3rd bed. What they tried to give us was ridiculous - no air in the "living room", no 3rd bed and no idea what to do to fix it. They transferred us to another hotel that was even worse. - Filthy - Bad service - Terrible Rooms You can do SO much better in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT FOOD. BAD POOLS”
Reviews.Author: antoniorz
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed there for 3 days with the premium all inclusive and its great! food is awesome, drinks are great, you can drink buchanans or grey goose and its all inclusive, the premium rooms are very good but the problem in this hotel is that theres no place to tan in the premium tower, theres too much mud and trees with 3 tanning beds, that is poor, service is regular but acommodations, food and beverage are great! ill return soon no doubt but sincerely i hope they improve the tan zone and the service. by the way there is no room service, thats bad!

Reviews.Title: “small hotel in playa del carmen cityview”
Reviews.Author: julimarbon
Reviews.Content: If you are a shopping and discotype of vacationguest try El Tukan its in the middel of 5th avenue in Playa del Carmen. Ideal for trips to Cozumel, Isla de Muhers and Xcarett Coba Tulum and Xelha. If you are a allinclusive tourist do not go here, the food is terrible, the swimingpool is too small and its too citylike to rest. Otherwise this is a great hotel to stay in for the night enjoy the nightlife, eat and drink on 5th and 10th avenue and take enough cash with you to pay up, it is not all inclusive. Just bed..and maybe breakfast.!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good restaruant, poor service”
Reviews.Author: jjuarezq
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one of the best restaurants in town (los tuilpanes) we were excelent attendant by Raymundo, unafortunadly I forgot some souvenirs into the room and when I called for claim, they don´t found them, very suspiccious, I think someone of the staff took them

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel right on 5th avenue!”
Reviews.Author: GlendaCoahuila
Reviews.Content: good breakfast, excelent location, friendly staff, nice rooms and well maintained installations. They also have a beach club on Playa Mamitas, free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “it was horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: cookielover75
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel, please. first, the "all inclusive" doesnt include anything at all. it includes one buffet, and it is rather gross. the beach is nice. but the so called beach club is a twenty minute walk. and it is this mangy bar that has rotten juice. there was no hot water. and if we were lucky enough the hot water lasted fifteen mintues. there was one very nice place to eat right in the hotel area and a bar, but you have to pay for the premium to go to them. there is one very small pool. and the rooms smell like mold. the people that work there are very rude. The manager was a rude little man. the people at the front desk were very bad. the manager charged is not professional he can not work with people, let alone communicate with them. He charged me for an extra day, the day that was already paid for. before the company i had booked with had a talk with this hotel, the manager kicked me out of my room and wanted to charge additional for getting out late. The only part of this vacation i remember is spending my time in the lobby figuring out problems. So if you want to waist your money, get stressed out and have problems then go to el tukan. but if you actually want to have a relaxed care free time, i recommend you to go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another one”
Reviews.Author: unhappy2011Finland
Reviews.Content: The only good things about this hotel are the location and the breakfast. I really don't recommend this hotel for the families with small children. The noise at night was terrible because the security at the hotel did nothing about the drunk yelling clients. The beds are terribly hard, they are not made for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Living Social/Urban Escapes was the way to go”
Reviews.Author: Tamara90c
Reviews.Content: We paid $900 for everything (minus the airfare) Included was 4 nights and 5 days in Playa del Carmen, an awesome excursion to Tulum complete with Zip Line, Rapelling into an underground Cenote, a Myan ritual by a Shaman, and an awesome lunch made by the women of the village. The next day we spent 7-8 hours at Xel-Ha...the greatest natural park, ever! Saturday we could have gone on another excursion for extra $$ but we chose to hang out at the beach and soak in some Yukatan culture. The beach club could be closer, but the mile down the coast with our feet in the sand was worth the walk. Look for the aqua blue tower...that is Kool beach. Service there is minimal, but if you tip well, it is quite worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Although service was usually great, the quality of the hotel was mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: IamMulti-lingual
Reviews.Content: Like I said before, the service we received from the front desk, the concierge (Fernanda), the tour co-ordinator (Marco), the wait staff at La Ceiba (Valentin, Manuel, etc,) was excellent. The service at our one and only dinner (which was included with our 7 night stay) at Las Tulipanas started out great, but once the wait staff thought that we didn't have a reservation (which they had already asked us if we had) even though we did, we no longer received service at all. Things that you should know (since we had to ask the questions ourselves, because the information was not given to us in the first place): there is only one restaurant that you can go to, the beach club is a bit of a walk away, the beds are very hard to sleep on, there aren't many loungers at the pool...etc. ASK! :D

Reviews.Title: “No frills budget hotel in GREAT location with decent staff”
Reviews.Author: loves2eat2010
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 girlfriends and purchased their basic all-inclusive package. It included the use of the beach club, only 5-10 min walk away with free drinks until 5pm. The beach club had palm beach cabanas with loungers to use, and was right beside 2 volleyball nets, which we used during half of our stay. Location: excellent! Right on 5a where all the hotels, restaurants, stores are. The clubs are only 2 blocks away, so far enough to not hear them, but close enough to enjoy at your leisure. Walked about 8 blocks to catch the colletiva (crowded, local transportation, but with a/c) when wanting to explore areas outside of Playa del Carmen without having to purchase from a tour operator. Rooms: it's budget. But having said that, it's equipped with an a/c box (ie. noisy, so bring earplugs if needed), and a basic TV with cable to watch movies or sports. Yes, most are in spanish, but then you're in Mexico. And they chambermaids do a good job of cleaning it. Just be aware, some rooms can be musty smelling, so I would suggest to continually ask them for a new room, even if it's every day. Sleep quality: the beds are somewhat firm, but I like firm mattresses so it was fine for me. If you only sleep on softer mattresses, consider bringing a mattress pad; some of my friends had difficulty sleeping because of it. Again, if you need complete quiet to sleep, but need the a/c on, bring ear plugs. Buffet restaurant, La Ceiba: this was across the street and our one restaurant included in our all-inclusive package. Food was good. Nothing exceptional, but they did try to change the dinner options each day. I'd recommend checking out the grill station for the best option...especially if it's tacos or omelettes for breakfast. Chicken was always good, usually fish except when it was salted too much, but beef/ pork tended to be too chewy each time. Staff at La Ceiba were WONDERFUL!!! Young Manuel and Valentin were very helpful and friendly. Very accommodating, funny, entertaining and really enjoyed their jobs. Tips: Ask for a to-go cup if you want a coffee while you walk to the beach. Ask for a to-go container to fill up with fruit to snack on at the beach between breakfast and lunch, too. A la carte restaurant, Los Tulipanes: one night with reservations included for each week you stay. Menu options were small for all-inclusive, but food was delicious! Shrimp tacos highly recommended as a starter/ appy. Again, beef tended to be chewy (in my fajitias), so order one of the other mains, as my friends did. Server, Victor, was very helpful, and drinks from the bar were delicious (Mojitos, tequila). One thing that turned our dining experience into an unpleasant one though, was the older Manuel (manager?). There was a mix-up with the date of our reservation: we asked for Friday, but it was written down on Saturday's schedule. The manager, Manuel, decided to blame us for arriving on the wrong date. Even after the discovery was made, he decided to shove the piece of paper for Saturday into my friend's face, to show her the date, which was written in Spanish, in the corner. The restaurant wasn't full the entire evening. We told him we were sorry for the mix-up, but we did request for the Friday, and assurred him we wouldn't try to come the following evening for the reservations, and he could even scratch our name out on the list. He didn't like our answer, so made the rest of our dinner very uncomfortable and awkward by getting our bill dropped off before we even finished our drinks. On top of that, our server wasn't allowed to serve us anymore, so even asking for our dessert and waiting for 40+ min, dessert was never served. It became a terrible restaurant experience for us, which was unfortunate, as we were planning on coming back another night to order from the regular full menu (like lobster), since the food and service, up to then, was so good. Let's just say we never returned for any meals there, and even paid to eat at another restaurant to boycott it. Service: it could be better at this hotel. When checking in, they didn't tell us of what was included in our all-inclusive package, or where to go to get certain things. For example, we read our notes, so knew about the beach club, but had to ask around for directions to it, and also discovered after arriving there, we had to pick up our beach towels at the front desk. I would suggest they have a little check-list of what is included in your all-inclusive package, with a little map of the different areas, instead of the generic Playa del Carmen map. Also, they never gave us a beach towel card, even after we asked if we needed one (not a problem), but one morning when we went to the front desk to ask for towels, the guy asked for our towel cards and wouldn't give us towels, until we exhaustively explained to him no cards were ever given to us. Pool: it's small. If you have kids and don't want to go to the ocean because of the salt water or waves, then it's nice to take a refreshing dip in. There's free Wi-Fi, but reception in some rooms can be sparse. And you need to bring your own laptop or smart phone. No computers/ business area to rent/ use.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Sage1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tukan with my spouse. I had read reviews before going and it can be loud during the nights due to the closeness of 5th avenue. However, we always ran the a/c everynight wich helped drown out the sound. We also brought earplugs just in case but I found i never had to use them when the a/c was on. I found the food at La Ceiba to be excellent. There was always a variety to choose from. The service was good too. I was somewhat dissappointed with the room when we first arrived. Kind of plain, boring and a bit dated. However, we didn't travel to Mexico to just stay in the hotel so it wasn't a big deal. It was a standard room with a king size bed. The bed was very hard. Some people may like this but i like plush beds so I found it hard to sleep and was stiff in the morning for the first few days there until I got used to it. There was hot water usually for about 10 minutes. The a/c and t.v. worked fine. We rented the safety deposit box for $1 a day which I would recommend. My spouse's prescription shampoo disappeared from the shower area which was kind of wierd, but otherwise nothing else ever went missing. We didn't spend much time at the pool and never went in, but laying around the pool was very relaxing with all the vegetation around. If you want to tan though the sun usually limited with all the trees...and people quickly grab up the areas with sun. The beach area was often busy...found it hard to find a chair and usually had to lay on the beach for awhile until two came available. They also have wireless if you have your laptop with you. Overall I found the Tukan to be pretty decent, we choose it instead of a beach resort outside Play because we wanted to be right in Playa and close to things. I would recommend the Tukan if you can get a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved El Tukan”
Reviews.Author: sivskatan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are simple and a bit worn down (in a charming way!) but fully functional (we didn't go to Mexico to watch TV or spend a lot of time indoors...!), the beds and pillows were soooo comfortable! We enjoyed the afternoon sun sitting in the balcony looking out at the lush garden. The breakfast buffet at La Ceiba is well worth the price (USD 7 at the time). All in all - our money were very well spent in this hotel. The hotel is situated in a crowded area, some nights were noisy - bring ear plugs of you are sensitive!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: canil
Reviews.Content: we stayed at el tukan for 2 weeks and I think it's a good budget hotel, the rooms are ok, clean and big.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you get a really good deal and don't have high expectations.”
Reviews.Author: shay_003
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Saturday and was shown our room - two double beds on the noisy side of the property. After reading these reviews we had requested a quiet room and a queen sized bed. We were told 'no problem' come to the front desk in the morning to get a different room. Went to the front desk in the morning and they said 'there are no more rooms, come back tomorrow and see if there is a better room"..Needless to say, this went on until Tuesday morning..each time the same answer..there are no rooms (even after we saw many many people check out). Service is absolutley lousy here. They will of course, upgrade to a 'premium room' if you pay $56 per night more - they suggested this each time..but would not accommodate moving us to a different 'standard' room. We eventually gave up asking and just had to live with sleeping in different beds (no snugs for us) We covered our heads with pillows each night as the band below our room was super loud and the walls super thin. It literally sounded like they were playing in our room! The standard 'all inclusive' only includes the buffet restaurant and none of the a la carte restaurants which was disappointing. The meals were repetitive and mundane..reminded me of a cuban all inclusive I went to last year at Lil Tuxpan. There was always something to fill you up, but nothing special ever. They never served tacos which is what I was looking forward to. We went out to eat about half the time. (you definitely NEED to check out Los Amigos at the corner of 30th ave and 26th street - it's SOOOOO cheap and tastey with a great little local atmosphere - 10 tacos, 2 pops and starter chips and dips for 74 pesos!) The rooms in this hotel were clean and bigger than I expected.....the beds were hard but sleepable. We always had hot water and satellite tv. We rented the security box in our room for $1 a day or so which was recommended. On the bus back to the airport we ran into people who 'used to' stay at this hotel but said it has gone down hill since the managment changed. They now stay at a sister hotel 2 blocks away called Playa Riel and said it's the same price but the food is much better and they have outstanding service. That's where I will stay next time too. The location is great - I would recommend staying in downtown playa del carmen rather than in the resort zone if you like to snoop around the area and people watch. As soon as you leave the hotel you are in the middle of fun shopping and lots of great little restaurants. We rented bikes and toured all over the city (rented bikes for $13 day at Carmen Sol on 30th avenue). It was a 10 minute walk to the beach but with the awesome weather..we didn't mind this jaunt at all. There were never enough lounge chairs on the beach and we often had to lie on the sand, but this didn't bother us too much. The pool and jacuzzi tub were very cold and completely uninviting..we rarely saw anyone there..don't go there for the pool! We had a great vacation in spite of some disappointments with this hotel. If you get a really good deal (say 1000 per week tax and flight in)..it would be okay to go here. We made the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: tristemere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tucan in June/July of 2010. The location is fabulous - right on 5th Ave. We stayed in the main building close to the central courtyard. The hotel grounds were pretty - tree filled and shady. We never had a problem with noise. Our room was spotless everyday. The only issue we had with the room was that the water line into the toilet had a minor leak. This made the tile floors a bit slippery from time to time. I kept meaning to let the front desk know and I just forgot - my own fault, not the hotels! The bar was great - comfortable and not too expensive. Don't do the all inclusive option! We had breakfast at the two hotel restaurants and were not terribly impressed. With all of the wonderful dining options in Playa it is totally worth it to eat outside the hotel. The beach club was all right. It was really close to the bathrooms (huge plus in my book). The chairs were comfortable and we had no problem with overcrowding. They didn't serve food but the staff from Kool (next door) were attentive and prompt. The beach club was more of a walk than I would have liked. The staff were always helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you DON*T want to sleep well.”
Reviews.Author: Lende1881
Reviews.Content: Central location of this hotel was the same time good thing but also it caused sleeping problems because the walls were very thinny and the very noisy music from the street came inside almost 24hrs/day. We need to use earplugs every night. Also at first night we need to change our room because it was so smelly, I think it was smell of mold. The Stuff was very nice anf helpful and the concierge gave us new room from opposite from our old room ( not for free anyway) That new room was much more better and it wasn*t smelly. I*m pretty sure that the other hotel building have got a serious mold problem.. The yard-area is well cared for and the cleaness of the rooms were good. It is two stars hotel but if you are interested at having good night sleeps and don*t want to listen every night music from the streets and the turning machines nice bellow in the mornings ( that awful noice came from site near by) i highly recommend you put some more money in the game and go to better and much quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unfortunately Amateurish”
Reviews.Author: Fengelz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days stay in El Tukan. And unfortunately I cant recommend it. The hotel looks nice and the staff is friendly and helpsome, but for the price paid, Its just not good enough. Our majot problem was that there was no hot water in our room. Our trip to the reception to complain became a daily routine, sometimes it was ignored but at some point it was fixed, only to vanish again the next day. One day with hot water out of 7 is just not good enough. On a more general note, they make you wear a plastic bracelet(?!!) while youre staying, which can be pretty annoying and cause scratches as it is sharp, and really, whats the point?! They have a jacuzzi by the swimming pool which is with cold water(?!!) Dont know if its just for shows or if they completely misunderstood the concept. There is no blowdryer with the room but you can borrow one for 2 hours (kind of annoying when the reception is on the other side of a large traffic heavy street), and finnally we had our laundry done, which I had to return to the reception 3 times to retrieve although it apparently was done after the first? Probably not the worst place in playa but they need to get a grip.

Reviews.Title: “"Is a hotel with good service and excellent location, totally recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAja
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was incredible, I highly recommend it, is a cheerful and relaxed at the same time. people who work there are friendly and committed to their work. I lost a personal object in the lobby of the hotel and staff sent it to my house..

Reviews.Title: “excellent Mexican hote”
Reviews.Author: fm2y
Reviews.Content: the hotel is excellent. The room is big and nice, in Mexican style and has a good bed. Theresa, our housekeeper is nice and she makes very nice figures with the towels. Also the room is very clean. The people on the front desk are very friendly. Fernanda, the concierge is also very nice and friendly and she tryed to make the reservation at Los Lupinos for the dinner if you have all-inclusive. You can take all-in at the reception for 3 days or more if you want. The food is good. The Beachclub is also very nice. We have nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: reistu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks. The location is very central, nearby the beach ( 5 minute walk). also nearby bus-terminal and ferry-pier (both 15 minute walk). Hotel is build in 3 blocks around the pool with a nice garden with palmtrees. The rooms are a bit basic, there is no refridgerator and there is no roomservice. I solved this by buing cold drinks at the nearby OXXO-conviencestores. The room lacked a glasscurtain so being situated on the grond floor we didn't have much privacy (note: all the other rooms had, so it was just bad luck we didn't have it). There was also no chair in the room to you could only sit on the bed. The breakfast is served as a buffet in an annnex restaurant "Ceiba" in a sidestreet, this was fine. Overall the service was OK and I would rate it 7 out of 10 (Europe) or C/B (USA).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fer22
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience. They treat me like if I were in home, the food was delicious. If I could came back I´ll do it without think it twice. :)

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT HOLIDAYS IN PARADAISE”
Reviews.Author: laurita0922
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all the Hotel staff for the great service that we received ,the wellcoming to the Hotel was excellent by Fernando who was always friendly and smilly, the rooms were great,the breakfast could inprove a bit by having so more food choices but generally good buffet and friendly staff,clean public areas and nice and clean playa beach club.Hope we can come back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , service and facilities!!...”
Reviews.Author: bekita69
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this Hotel, you can go everywhere from there, since it's just on the 5th avenue, excellent location, We got the "Premiun all inclusive" meal plan, which allowed us to try different Restaurants including from Real Playa del Carmen Hotel. Food was really good at La Ceiba, and Tulipanes Restaurants, and service was very good as well. We enjoyed the beautiful blue ocean and white sand in Playa del Carmen, just sitting and relaxing at the "Kool beach bar", where drinks were also incluided!!... could you believe it?..After a nice day at beach or some adventure tour, we spent some time at "Legends Sport Bar and grill",again good food and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: mayandiver68
Reviews.Content: I booked 12 nights at the hotel, in my recent trip for business and placer being Mexican was difficult in off, they make you feel like 3rd class citizen, I own a tour operation company, being in lots of hotels around the world, never being treated like that, one night a friend come to visit me to talk business they make me pay 170 pesos for my friend to enter the hotel, policies of the hotel the night receptionist toll me, very unpleasant staff to deal with, I would definitely blame the management and human resources, stay awaty from the concentration camp.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - worst service I have ever received”
Reviews.Author: JGDALLAS
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews prior to booking. I had the exact same problems others have had. I booked 3 rooms for myself and extended family. Once arriving to the hotel they split us up and put 2 of our rooms across the street in a completely different complex and 1 room act ually at the Tukan on 5th av. I explained to them when people book multi rooms they should keep them together........at least this is how its done in the U.S. The manager came and was not helpful and needless to same the service there really SUCKS. The bathrooms were not the cleaniest we had to were flipflops in the shower. In another room the air conditioner leaked water inside the room and all we could do was put towels on the floor to soak up the water. After all the terrible service they still expected everyone in my party to be present during check-out time (@ the Recption desk) to cut off dumb arm tags that served no purpose since they weren't even checking them to validate you were actually stayin in the hotel. This hotel has no security anyone can just walk in but they don't mind NOT BEING HELPFUL OR COURTEOUS.

Reviews.Title: “Centre jungle”
Reviews.Author: Twlip
Reviews.Content: Very simple and a bit worn hotel by the 5th Ave, near the beach. Also an "own beach" but only the transfer there was good. I just enjoyed living in this hotel as in a small jungle, birds and animals, good breakfast. Easy to walk everywhere, not for snobs!

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: SillyGirlMty
Reviews.Content: Hi guys, that hotel was the worst ever, the people from hotel stole my iphone and my friend´s camara, they sneak in to my room wile i was sleeping, the manager of the hotel Alejandro was so rude with us, they dont response. they dont have security, NO CAMERAAAS. The rooms are cheap but no Security. And the lecture of the card is not working.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Anthony068
Reviews.Content: well, as someone who travels often (I'm a travel agent) and usually in upscale properties, I was a bit worried at first, but it turned out to be really great place! The grounds are wonderful and soooo full of vegetation. It is like an oasis in the middle of the city. Just amazing. Very clean, very comfortable rooms. Yes, they r a bit old, but nevertheless, it was fine. good beds, great terrasse and amazing location. For the price, its just unbelievable. The buffet breakfast was great. No complaints. We didn't take the all-inclusive package, but there are two of them, the regular one and the Premium one. The Premium one sounds pretty good, and is a good deal, but I was traveling around a bit, and I love to try all those restaurants in Playa! The beach club they have is GREAT. Right near Mamitas, the best beach around. Only about a 10min walk to get there. Fernanda, the concierge at the hotel is wonderful. She is really amazing.... so nice! All in all, I was very happy. This is not a resort hotel, so if you like to be in the middle of nowhere with G.o.'s entertaining you, then this place is not for you. If you like to be able to move around, and be in the heart of everything, where allll of Playa is your entertainment, then I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value- as long as you upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: beersteakhockey
Reviews.Content: I paid $965 return from Calgary for a week all inclusive at the El Tukan and was mostly there to scuba dive and relax. The only restaurant and bar included is across the street plus one beach club (a 5-10 minute walk) with a limited nbr of chairs. There was no bar beside the pool as it has closed. After eating my first meal at the included restaurant I was disappointed- it was average at best. Upon talking to the concierge Marcos (who was extremely friendly and helpful) I was offered an upgrade ($25 US/ night) for 3 other restaurants, 2 bars, a sports lounge and another beach club. The Tulipanes restaurant and the Living bar is right on 5th Ave joined to the hotel. I was able to order off the menu here and the food was excellent. The sports bar "Legends" is half a block away and was only AI until 8 pm but has all the NHL games and is modern with comfy chairs The other restaurants and bar are at the Real Playa hotel located about 6 blocks away. The only time I went there was to try the mexican restaurant "Marias" but ended up going back to the Tulipanes as the menu didn't have as many choices and the included wine was crap. My room was on the top floor and had a balcony looking out into the forest like courtyard. The room was pretty basic but clean and the AC and ceiling fan worked fine. The shower could have used more pressure but it did the trick. I only spent a couple hours around the pool but it was clean and I found it refreshing to jump into after lying on the chairs for a while. All in all I really enjoyed my week but was very glad I upgraded. I was staying there for the price and location mainly. If you want a 3 star plus hotel then this is not the place for you and I can understand why peolple would be upset if they only had the one restaurant and bar to eat at all week.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to rest”
Reviews.Author: Fuego1980
Reviews.Content: We ended up here having a 7 night stay to have a nice visit @ Mayan Riviera. The atmosphere of the main building looked real good to me. After check-in we were guided to the other side of the street, a building next to the AI restaurant. Well, what a hell, facing a all night busy street where it was impossible to sleep even with the use of earplugs. Room was clean but the building was horrible, very noisy and much of the concrete walls even never finished Well been there, done that, after many compaining and begging (don't give up, show your sleepless eyes) we got free upgraded to their sister hotel Real Playa which was heaven comparing El Tukan (Quiet,Spacious Appt). So don't stay here if you would like to sleep at night. Even though a plus for the service and atmosphere in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations; good food; great location”
Reviews.Author: dangerwendy
Reviews.Content: Pluses: The location is great! Close to shopping, restaurants, beach, dive shop, etc. The foliage is very pretty. The rooms contain the bare minimum, but the beds were comfortable and the linens were clean. The walls are thin and we could hear the neighbors and lots of loud noise from the sports bar across the street. There is no hot water in the jaccuzzi near the pool, which was disappointing. My package came with a daily breakfast, which was fantastic. Great selection of foods and beverages. One complaint: do NOT take off your bracelet (which you need to eat in the restaurant). If you remove it and do not turn it in for a replacement, you will be charged. Also, you will be required to turn it in at check out or you will be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious, clean, and safe”
Reviews.Author: Vikingsdottir
Reviews.Content: if you want a plush five-star resort on the beach, this is not the place for you. However if you want a place that's well-established, clean, quiet and looked after by pleasant staff, then be sure to check in here. The gardens are well established, the pool is great for kids to splash in , and it sits right on 5th Avenue, the major thoroughfare in Playa del Carman. The only detractor is that the hot tub is not hot; rather kind of luke-warm.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for us”
Reviews.Author: krazzySask
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the el tukan for 4 nights in the prime week of feb. The room we had was a 2 bedroom suite on the 3rd floor facing the reception area. The rooms were very spacious and had a tv in each room, a kitchen, bath with shower , and a prv balcony with 2 chairs a patio table. The master bedroom had a king size bed,, and the other had two twin beds. The rooms were dated but very clean and the air units in both rooms worked good. There was no fridge in room. The hot water was fine but if u liked really long showers you might run short. We were able to get internet access from our balcony which was great. We did not take them up on their offer for the all inclusive which I think is the best choice being you are right n the middle of playa and there are many restaurants to indulge at . House keeping was great and did a good job every day ,, and the staff and front reception were very friendly. I would rate the rooms here as 2.5 star and the hotel itself as a 3 star. The beds were firm but very comfortable (this is mex after all). Noise from fifth ave was never a problem. The location of this hotel is excellent and for what we needed it fit the bill perfect. It was our home base and we used it for showering etc and relaxing after exploring all that playa has to offer. We used there beach club one day which is included with the price of the room, but if u dont need a beach chair u can walk straight east of the hotel 2 mins and u are on the beach. We paid 109 a night after we booked on line at their web site (booking at the front desk was 225 a night) . I would stay here again but if your looking for a five star this is not for you , but if you want convience and a clean room right in the middle of everything playa has to offer this is it. Have fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Yaena
Reviews.Content: I went on an AI package, and was rather disappointed with several important things. First and foremost - if you think you're booking a room at the Tukan, beware that you may not end up actually getting a room there. We were placed in the Moongate, across the street - a FAR inferior hotel. There was no glass on the window, only wooden slats that could be opened and closed. There was a window directly behind our (very, very hard) bed, that opened onto the (busy and loud) 5th Avenue. We did not get any sleep our first night because of this, and when we requested a room in the actual Tukan the next morning, we were told it would cost an extra $120 to upgrade to a suite. We did upgrade, and this made a huge difference. Our new room was on the 3rd floor, with a balcony that faced the pool. All of the furniture was in good repair, the bed was slightly softer, the windows had glass, and the room was always very clean. One ceiling fan didn't work, and the remote for the TV didn't work, either - but the AC was wonderful. The housekeeping staff were excellent - we did not use the safe and didn't lose anything. Each day, the staff arranged towel art for us. However, there was very little hot water (not enough for a full shower, ever). It was also difficult to get a straight answer from the front. For instance, we attempted to arrange a late check out, and were given conflicting information, despite the fact our room was not needed during the time we were requesting. After fighting for the late check out, we won - but had to pay 100 pesos an hour for it (nearly $10/US an hour). Other than the front desk personnel, I enjoyed all of the Tukan staff. The restaurant servers could be hit and miss (but if you leave a small tip, your experience will be hugely improved - we did so regularly, and had servers coming to our table to take drink orders, etc.). I also noticed servers repeatedly carrying plates to tables for the elderly, which was nice to see. The bell boys are friendly, and seem to know more about the area (and speak better English) than the front desk staff as well. And I can't say enough great things about Marco, who arranges tours for you (he has a desk by reception). He is friendly, knowledgeable, speaks several languages, and is full of energy. He never expects or asks for a tip (though we gave him one on the last day, and he was extremely gracious). The location of the actual Tukan was great - set back from 5th, through a beautiful garden, that muffled the noise but kept the action close. The beach club was very crowded, and it is difficult to get a seat not in the shade. There were definitely not enough chairs - they were full before 11 am - and the beach club bar/servers were miserable. The beach itself is beautiful, but the sand is becoming rather dirty (cigarette butts, other garbage, etc.). The buffet included with the AI plan is monotonous. Breakfast NEVER changes, and the coffee is atrocious (the first morning, we actually had to spoon coffee grounds out of the cup). The fresh fruit is wonderful, however. Lunch is okay, dinner usually follows a theme. Nothing terribly exciting, and we ate out despite the AI plan rather frequently. And as another reviewer mentioned - the hot tub is cold. At least as cold as the pool. I went swimming in an underground cenote that was warmer than the "hot tub". All in all, it is doubtful I would recommend the Tukan to aynone, or return myself, thanks to the problems had with the front - which is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “4th time at the El Tukan....definitely the last”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeasely
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the hotel today. This is our fourth and unfortunately the last time we will be staying at the El Tukan! The reasons are as follows, number one....bumped to the Real Playa when we got here for 3 nights of a 16 night stay....a mere 15 blocks from the El Tukan. If I wanted to stay there I would have booked to stay there. Also, we booked for 16 nights so that we would not be 'living out of the suitcase" that is what they had us doing for three nights. The food here this year is just terrible. Breakfast is wierd.....strangest scrambled eggs I have ever seen....if only they would leave them alone, something might be normal on he menu. Lunch is the best..if you can call it that...and dinner is a complete repeat of lunch. Not worth what we paid, we have never eaten out so much before after booking at an all inclusive. The beach club this year has been hit and miss. Sometimes they have someone there that can mix drinks, other times.....nothing but jungle juice in a plastic cup....yuck! The room service has been good, up untill today the room was kept clean and done in a timely fashion...today...well its 2:00pm and we have requested twice that the room get done, mainly so we can get some clean towels...and here we wait and wait and wait. I honestly cannot wait to book out of this place on sunday. Next year we will return to the riviera maya as it is beautiful here, but there are many good all inclusive options availalbe at a comparable price. For the last three years this hotel was good. So good that we never considered staying anywhere else, the food and services were good, the location was perfect! Right now the only thing going for this hotel is the location....and that is not enough for me to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Prairiefolk3
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were travelling with our son, daughter in law and children aged 10 & 13,staying in 2-2 bedroom suites. Our room had been recently refurbished & was adequte. Our son's room was quite the opposite.--light frixtures with EXPOSED WIRING, NO SMOKE ALARMS, small bugs on the counter, patio table with one leg half rotted, & deck chairs that had missing arm rests. A gigantic wasp was building a nest on the roof of the patio. When we addressed these concerns with the front desk, an attendant came to verify same. We were told someone would be around immediately to correct the problems. This did not happen. My son went out & bought raid to eliminate the wasps. The following morning, after further discussion with the front desk, they were moved to the top floor (nice suite recently refurbished but still NO SMOKE DETECTOR. Again alerted the front desk. Later that day a smoke detector was installed outside of the suite in the open air corridor. How would that work in the event of a fire? We purchased the breakfast plan for our 3 day stay at a cost of $27.00 per person. BIG MISTAKE. The coffee tasted like mud, the hot buffet was anything but fresh (? leftovers from their main restaurant the night before) The only redeeming quality was the omelet bar & the French toast. The atmosphere was terrible--hot, crowded, & noisy. We could have done much better on the 5th avenue strip & enjoyed the experience. The Beach Club is very crowded. We had stayed at the El Tukan on 2 previous occasions 4 & 5 years ago. I cannot believe the negative changes with respect to quality & service. They charge your credit card up front, when you check in, and don't really care. The maid service was fine, however as previous comments, the floors looked clean & shiny but walking in bare feet revealed otherwise. We will never stay there again. Quite spoiled an otherwise wonerful 10 day vacation at the Myan Reviera.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Karen5056
Reviews.Content: Well I suppose in some way this is not the fault of the hotel but you don't necessarily get what you see. the hotel has 3 other tiny satellites on the corners near the hotel that you may be put in with a lovely view of traffic, a street or a concrete wall therefore no sun and a block walk on a very busy street or cross the street and walk across the property you thought you were staying at to the buffet and the bar. i was not spending 2 weeks looking at a concrete wall so we had to fork out $350 USD to get a room around the pool area which was very nice and what I had expected to get in the first place. We just had the buffet AI as we were not impressed with the food in the restaurant. The buffet has no ambiance whatsoever and was hot and stuffy inside and all the smokers were outside not hesitating to blow smoke in your face as you ate but the food was very good. We Canadians are spoiled in seldom having to tolerate cigarette smoke. - Mexico should update it's smoking laws. The buffet was extremely clean and had a variety of foods different every evening. Anyway the place is very clean - not in very good repair but clean. The grounds are lovely and very well kept. We ended up really liking it but will go for a higher end all-inclusive next time mainly because there was no bar service at the pool, no refrigerator in the room either to purchase your own and just dinky little plastic cups at the bar to carry over across a street (a just parking street) to the hotel but it was great being right in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good, decent, clean hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Jonezin
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler, this was a decent hotel, in a great location, and had what I mostly needed....a place to sleep and shower. The rooms were simple and clean and attended to on a daily basis. The bed mattress was a little firm, but worked okay for me. Had a balcony on the top floor with a table and two chairs overlooking the beatiful grounds below. The bathroom was okay, except the showerhead needed replacing, had streams of water spraying in different directions. So unless the shower curtain was closed, water would spray all over the bathroom floor. There was also a TV with close to 100 channels. The location of this hotel is prime, you can walk right out on to 5th street from the lobby/courtyard, and a short walk to you beach. Because of its location, it is not always quiet during the nighttime either due to pedestrian or street traffic. It's nothing a pair of earplugs cannot fix. For the most part, the staff was courteous and helpful. The only qualm I had was the railing on the stairway was recently painted, still wet, and no 'wet paint' sign (in spanish or english) nearby. As such, I grabbed it on my way up the stairs and got wet paint on my hand. A worker nearby witnessed it, but just smiled and didn't do/say anything.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: WICorgis
Reviews.Content: Arrived expecting a 2 star motel and was pleasantly surprised. Walk right into the mature courtyard from 5th avenue, yet amazingly quiet at night. Rooms are definitely dated, but clean. We asked for one king bed in our reservation but ended up with 2 doubles...hotel was full. Internet connection only works close to the reception area. Always seemed to be someone at the reception area who spoke English. Rooms have nice patios/porches, although the screen door wouldn't stay on the track. The beach club (Kool beach club on Playa Tukan-end of Calle 28) is a 10-15 minute walk. We went at 3pm on a Tuesday & found plenty of chairs/umbrellas. On our second night, a leak in the water pipes occurred resulting in water on our floor. The manager, Alberto, was very accommodating. He arranged for us to move to a suite at another motel they work with, the Real Playa del Carmen (see separate review), and included breakfast in the deal (we usually prefer European Plan). Location is important to us and our room is just a place to sleep; given this we would consider El Tukan again. If you want to spend the majority of time on the resort property, you may want to look at other, more expensive lodging options.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great location - close to Spanish school, beach, nightlife”
Reviews.Author: vagabonddoc
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights Dec 5-12, 2009 at El Tukan and was very satisfied with the quality and value. Including taxes, I paid 59 per night (price the same for single or double occupancy) for a good sized room with two double beds, a desk and chair, nice sized bathroom with a large shower (no bath), pretty patio with two chairs, a table, and greenery surrounding. The hot water, ceiling fan and air conditioning worked very well and the room cooled quickly. There was a good sized television with cable. My room had wireless internet access but not all rooms do. They also have wireless internet access in the lobby. A good quality safe deposit box is available for $1 per night (you get the key and lock mechanism to insert). The room was kept clean and fun towel art was provided daily. The cleaning staff were helpful and responsive. The hotel grounds were lush, the location of the hotel perfect for exploring Playa, and it was ideal for me taking a Spanish course at the IH Riviera Maya school which was one minute away by foot. There is an inexpensive laundry next door (Lava Facil) if you need one and choose not to use the hotel's service. There is also a convenience store at the corner with sodas, water, beer, snacks, etc. I didn't do the all-inclusive but I ate at the El Tukan restaurant, which sits along 5th Avenue, and the food was reasonably priced and pretty good. I had the breakfast buffet there and the hotel/restaurant staff brought juice and took my order for omelettes (included in buffet price) cooked to order. The buffet wasn't massive but it had everything I wanted for less than 10 dollars. Prices for breakfast buffets were about the same everywhere. The location of the hotel in the center of the action allows you to eat at a different place for every meal if you wish. The hotel does not offer a refrigerator in the room unless you require it for insulin, etc. Though adjacent to 5th avenue, my hotel room was very quiet. There are no clocks or phones in the rooms so bring an alarm clock if you need to be up at a particular time. There were no bad odors in, or around, my room. There is adequate space for clothing in the armoire and drawers in the desk, also. There were only three hangers, so you may need those, also. The prices were better if booking through their web site, tukanhotels.com, than from other sites I looked at and much cheaper than booking at their front desk. Though within walking distance, a free shuttle runs from the hotel to the beach club regularly through the day, and returns every two hours. Their beach club is very nice with plenty of chairs and palapas and use of a pool there. I went to the beach at prime times and never had problems finding a chair or palapa but I didn't travel during the prime season. The pool at the beach looked nice but is not a pool for small children. Service was good at the beach club for drinks. Bring a bag to take to the beach and maybe take your lunch and/or drinks with you. The pool at the hotel was very nice with plenty of lounge chairs and a hot tub adjacent. I didn't try the hot tub but kids were having plenty of fun in the pool. The hotel gives you one beach towel and you can exchange it is many times as you like. I did check out Nina, their less expensive (if you can call 59/night expensive) facility on Calle 6. Their rate, including tax, was 35 usd per night. They were 8 blocks from the main hotel and pool and the rooms were a little smaller, tv's a little smaller, and the two rooms I checked out smelled a little of mildew to me. That smell may go away with the air conditioners on but I can't say for sure. The Nina had lounge chairs in a grassy garden area but you would have access to the El Tukan pool and beach club. If you were looking at a cheap place, it would beat the youth hostel which I didn't hear much positive about. It was a very international and pleasant group of guests in residence. Taxis are cheap within this zone of Playa so you could easily walk to Wal-Mart and catch a cab back to the hotel with an inexpensive Styrofoam cooler and some supplies/drinks. Whenever I went to the front desk there was always someone who spoke fluent English and French. To get there from the airport, if traveling alone without more than a rolling suitcase and a backpack, just take the ADO bus. It leaves from the airport regularly, is very comfortable, air conditioned, usually has US movies on the television, goes non-stop directly to the Juarez/5th Avenue bus station in Playa for about 100 pesos (about 8 usd) per person. Just convert 10 dollars to pesos in the airport. Convert any more money at better rates in Playa. It's a short walk to the hotel from the bus station, or you can catch a cab for very little money from the bus station. My only complaints were the usual Riviera Maya hard mattress, and the tile floor in the room could use a good scrubbing. The tile was mopped daily (I saw them doing it) and looked very clean but after walking on it barefoot for a short time, my feet were black. I kept my sandals beside the bed and outside the shower to keep on at all times. Overall, a great value and if I return to Playa, I'll definitely go to El Tukan.

Reviews.Title: “Already have a trip back planned”
Reviews.Author: Sandraminnesota
Reviews.Content: Fabulous bargain, tropical setting. Clean rooms (no elevator). Great location near beach, and right on the main street (no cars allowed) where you can walk and see lots of free entertainment and activity. Quiet at night. Near so many restaurants, from cheap to ritzy. When showed them some dirt on the wicker furniture in the lobby, it was hauled out and scrubbed squeaky clean within hours. Staff helped me with a tricky phone call.

Reviews.Title: “good price nice location”
Reviews.Author: adrianyadriana
Reviews.Content: well we stayed for 5 nights from june 19th till the 24 th... and we had a great time.. only thing is that no phone in the rooms.. and you have to go to the reception to get wifi.. they have a great beach club about 8 to 10 blocks away.. but it work the walk.. besides the hote have a shuttle from hotel to the beach... we stayed at room 323 3rd or 4th floor hate the stairs.. but . i guess is just for 5 days..

Reviews.Title: “Great value for us”
Reviews.Author: voyager-sue
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Moongate, during the recession but before the flu scare, for $50 a night. The Moongate was closed and they put us up across the street at the Hotel Tukan, which is a nice looking hotel built around a lush tropical garden. The rate included a substantial breakfast buffet, and the Tukan Beach Club. The Beach Club was about 8-10 blocks away (they have a shuttle to the beach), a beautiful beach, and it saved us from paying $8/day for 2 chairs and a palapa. We could also buy drinks and lunch there, and did. The hotel is right on 5th Avenue (Quinta Avenida), which is pedestrian only and lined with shops and restaurants, etc. The room was OK, but very dim. When we turned on the one ceiling light we could barely tell it was on. You definitely couldn't read by it. We asked for a lamp and they gave it to us, and that helped. Also, there was no chair, but we brought in one from our patio, so that worked. And the bed was hard, but surprisingly not uncomfortable. The bathroom was fine, plenty of hot water, new fixtures, 2 lights in the bathroom vs. only 1 in the room, nicely decorated. So I got the impression that other rooms were much nicer than ours, and also more expensive. I can see in the hotel photos that they have more lights and look really nice. But since I don't know what the other rooms are like and how much they go for, I can't say if it is such a good value for everyone. But we enjoyed our stay there, and considering the location and the generally pleasing grounds and the nice breakfast, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Great Value and Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: zafarse
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days in Playa at this hotel and it was great! I had planned on going Apr.17-27 with a buddy and we booked the Moongate Hotel (a sister hotel to the El Tukan) across the street. We booked with Expedia and booked 2 double beds. On arrival, we were told we had a king at the Moongate which was totally unacceptable. They said no problem, we will put you in El Tukan the first night and in the AM you can discuss this with the manager. We went to the room (406) and found it was poolside with a nice deck surrounded by palms. This room was perfect! Upon entering the room, the entrance is separate from the sleeping area with counter space, cupboards, and a sofa. This was perfect as the first day we went to Walmart for a few supplies.
