Picked up a styrofoam cooler ($4), 1 cup coffee maker ($9), beer, Don Julio tequlia, Controy and margarita mix. Also some plastic spoons and large plastic cups for making margaritas. Who needs AI! I'd do about a 30 block hike each morning taking photos and return to enjoy the PM with a margarita on the deck by the pool. The pool was never crowded and there were always chairs available. I think most people went to the beach. Management allowed us to stay in this room the entire 10 days. I think the hotel uses the Moongate across the street as an overflow. The whole time I was there I never saw any guests entering or leaving the Moongate. The room was always clean with towel art every day but I made sure to leave 50 pesos on the pillow each morning for the maid. The room was always cleaned by 11 AM when I returned from my hike. All the staff I met were friendly and with a quick Hola whenever you saw them. Maitenance, security, front desk, housekeeping, it didn't matter, they all had a greeting and a smile for you. The hotel itself is in a prime location. Right on 5th Ave. but far enough north so you are away from most of the pushy vendors. From Calle 14 south to the pier you seem to run the gauntlet of vendors but this hotel is a couple blocks north of that and the vendors don't seem so pushy. You are surrounded by great restaurants, bars, and small hotels in this neighborhood. Dubai, Coco Bongo, End Zone, Tequila Barrel are all within a block or 2 and there is a great pizza stand across the street for late night snacks. This was my 4th trip to the Riviera Maya but my 1st time staying in Playa and not at an AI. After this trip, I will never stay at an AI again. My last 3 trips were at a 5 star resort, and if you're willing to give up a little pampering and amenities, this 3 star hotel has everything you need in a perfect location! I am already planning a 3 week trip for July and will definitely try to book El Tukan again. By the way, when we subtracted our airfare from the total cost, our stay cost $52CDN/night split 2 ways without the AI option. You just can't beat value like that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but lots of room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Family_o_fun
Reviews.Content: We've been to Mexico too many times to count and I am a bit on the fussy side so take my review with a grain of salt. Rooms: old, in dire need of maintenance and updating although the beds were comfortable. Nice to have hammocks on the balcony. We stayed at poolside which to me was the absolute best spot - room 401. No hair dryers, no coffee makers, no coffee to be had anywhere at hotel before 7:00 am (if you are an early riser). Cleanliness: Room cleaning hit and miss. Some days lovely towel art and sparkling floors. Other days a bit to be desired. Balcony area never once swept or cleaned so I eventually found a broom and did myself. Staff: Overall pretty friendly maintenance and cleaning staff. Excellent, friendly and diligent security staff...really felt safe. However front desk staff not so accommodating (except wonderful man who checked us in...didn't catch his name...only friendly one) they seem annoyed when you ask for anything...ie: I desperately needed an extra garbage bag to tidy up our room and I was told to go ask housekeeping...housekeeping didn't have any!! Never got a bag and gave up. One example of many. Grounds: Excellent very clean pool, well maintained. No pool bar or service. Food: Good breakfast. Lunch and Supper with plenty of mystery meat and potatoes. Rarely salads or any variation on fruit offerings: papaya and melon. Many people seemed to enjoy the food. I had a hard time. A vegetarian wouldn't make it at all. Mostly meat/potatoes/breads. I have never eaten so many buns/butter. Why no Mexican food!!!??? Also on the restaurant: they are militant about carrying a coffee or beer to your room-want you to use Styrofoam yet never have any available. A bit of a hassle with having to cross the street and the environment of the eating hall is a bit like a hospital cafeteria....no ambiance what-so-ever. I worked it out that the food budget we would have had without the 'all inclusive' would have been about $200 per day for our family of three and we could have had some pretty good food for that - not the same crud day in and day out. Location: Many people comment the 5th ave location is great, however I found it noisy. I will not choose to stay off of the beach again. It was a pain to get to the beach and then there were not enough chairs and as several people have mentioned-no food-not even nachos served at beach club. The "all inclusive" does not include water sports equipment, etc that is usually part of an all inclusive. General: Most guests are European it seems. Most guests very nice, quiet and reserved-in general a quite resort..no partiers in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at El Tukan!”
Reviews.Author: FirsttimersCalgary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Playa Del Carmen. We had a fantastic stay at El Tukan, and would highly recommend it! A few things to keep in mind: this is not a five star resort, so the food is okay, and the rooms are older. But if your looking to save a buck at a clean hotel, and still be in the centre of town, then its definitely worth looking into. If possible, try to book a 1bdrm premium all inclusive package. For the extra cost (approx. $200), it is well worth every penny. Here is what we thought: What we liked: - The room we were in (401) is clean... no bugs, mold etc... - The service is by far five star quality - talk to Marco when booking tours. He will find the best deals. - The location is right in the centre of all the action on 5th ave. Yet tucked away enough that the nights were still quiet and romantic. - The grounds are beautiful with lush tropical plants, and large palm trees. - With the premium package we had a choice between the buffet meals or a sit down meal at the little restaurant next to the hotel. And we could have free drinks at the bar on the hotel grounds. Well worth the extra cost! - We took our three year old daughter with us, who has food allergies. Marco arranged for us to meet with the manager at the buffet restaurant who put together a special menu just for her. I cannot express how much we appreciated that - esp. given that this is not a 5 star hotel! - Beach club is beautiful, with no rocks and lots of white sand. We had many people tell us that we had the nicest area of beach on the entire strip...and we believe it! - No line ups...ever! With only 133 rooms, you never have to line up for reservations or fight for pool side chairs. The beachclub is another matter..... Dislikes: - If you go with the standard package, you are limited to free food and drinks at the buffet only. There isn't really much of a bar, and the buffet food is a bit repetitive. But still very tasty, with a good variety. Again....go premium. - The pool is only 3-4 ft deep, and is rather small. Not good for those that enjoy doing laps. - Very little to do for kids. We didn't mind as our daughter is young enough to entertain herself with a bucket of sand. But I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anyone with older children that want to play at the pool, or at a kids club. - space at the beach is limited, so if you want a chair in the shade - go early! We always arrived between 10am -1pm and were able to find space...but it wasn't always easy. -the beds are hard hard hard....but apparently that is quite normal for Mexico. I would much rather a hard bed at a 3 star vs. cockroaches at a 5 star!! TIPS: - Go Premium!!! I really cannot stress that enough!! - Apparently this is very rare, but we saw a scorpian in the garden on our second night and nearly stepped on it. I would recommend keeping balcony doors closed...just in case of little visitors. When we told the hotel staff...the were all shocked as none of them have ever witnessed scorpians at the hotel. - The beach club is a bit of a walk away. But you can walk right along 5th ave. where there is tons to see on the way. If walking is not for you, there is a shuttle that runs regularily. Overall - this is an awesome place to stay, and we will definitely be back....but maybe without the little one next time. Happy Vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxed, week-long all inclusive.”
Reviews.Author: myheartsinmexico
Reviews.Content: First timers to the Caribbean side of Mexico and we weren't disappointed. We travelled with Signature Vacations on a last minute deal. There were aspects I loved about the trip and aspects I did not love...I hope this helps you make your decision. Loved: -King sized bed in a large, corner room on the fourth floor (I emailed the hotel directly to ask for a room on the quiet side, away from those travelling with children.) I was pleased with this room. -Hotel staff really try to make you as comfortable as possible. I was happy that most spoke english and that they said hi whenever they saw me and my partner. Marco, the concierge, was the most helpful and suggested tours and touristy things to do. I was surprised to hear him speaking fluent french to other guests-very impressive!! Eugento at the beach club is friendly as well as the other man who worked with him-I didn't catch his name though. They'll make you any sweet girly drink you can name. -La Cieba buffet restaurant staff try really hard to keep your drink filled and your empty plates cleared. Breakfast was my favorite meal there, while my partner loved the lunches. Ok selection-something for everyone but its an average buffet - good enough for all-inclusive. -The hotel gardens are beautiful and help keep the street noise to a minimum. Large palm trees and well tended gardens were beautiful, home to plenty of little lizards that may join you on the pool deck for some sunning. The pool is refreshingly cool to the hot sun. Didn't love: -We had a late flight and arrived at the hotel around 1:30am since Playa is aprox. 45minutes away. As a courtesy it would have been nice of the hotel to have something for us to eat/drink when we arrived. I know this isn't the hotels fault-for when the flights happen-but maybe if they prepared for late check ins the guests would feel a little better taken care of. -The beach club is easily 10-15 minutes away, and you have to basically leave right after breakfast to get a lounge chair/umbrella for the day. Like another reviewer mentioned, they only serve drinks. The food at the Kool beach club right next door is pricey. This is definitely something they should reconsider-even if it's serving fruit or buns, even peanuts. I liked the exercise, but some people will not like that the beach club is far from the hotel. -I am a messy person, and I find it embarrassing for someone I don't know to see my dirty underwear or my unmade bed. I don't need housekeeping every day, so I kept the do not disturb sign on the door. The day before departure the sign was up when we left and when we returned our room had been serviced. I found this very intrusive and annoying. -Our departure flight was at 10:45am and our transfer van arrived and wanted to leave at 7:00am. The signature rep said that departure would be around 7:15am so I was disappointed that we had to leave without eating breakfast. The front desk agent, at the time, seemed eager to have us check out and cut our all-inclusive bracelets off. I found this very sneaky-and chintzy. We ended up eating at the airport. (gross!)

Reviews.Title: “Rates better than an 2 1/2 star for sure”
Reviews.Author: CocoandMikki
Reviews.Content: El Tukan is an excellent place to stay for couples and families. It has a great beach club only a short walk on the beach away, the food and drink are always flowing at the all -inclusive pavillion across the street (where you hang and meet people anyway) and the hotel rooms and grounds are clean and lush. The service is always quick, polite and with a smile - everyone is always eager. We loved our stay and hope to go back next year

Reviews.Title: “beautifull courtyard”
Reviews.Author: playadel50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Eltoukan 3 times now . And will be there again on Feb 7th, 2009 one week all inclusive. I do agree with others , that a small fridge would be ideal in the standard room . As far as the food , i've had better , but so many good restaurants in Playa that you can eat cheap and much better.the beach club should be closer to the hotel . The beer is not very good ( the big brown bottles ) not much choice in beers. I have never seen a Beach club without any food . At least a BBQ, for hot dogs or fries . Just a very small menu would be better than nothing. the rooms are ok , need renovations , but I thought it was clean enough . Never had facecloths, but ok i'll bring mine this time . sitting in front of 5th Ave, sipping a nice coffee or a cocktail would be nice too , afterall we are guests too . I feel that they have strong limitations and somewhat at times felt like an outsider in our hotel . cheers !!! See you soon

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, OK room, a bit far from the beach”
Reviews.Author: lizu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Tukan Condotel for 7 nights over Xmas break in 2008-2009. It wasn't our choice, we had prepaid a room at the Illusion Hotel, who overbooked and handed us over to El Tukan. Location: El Tukan is one of the larger Playa hotels, situated on 5th Ave, and taking up almost a whole square block. It is wonderfully quiet, though conveniently close to restaurants and bars. The beach: The sea is 2 blocks away; although that part of the shore is taken up by the marina. The actual beach is a 10-25 minute walk away, depending on how far you're willing to walk to avoid the crowds. The hotel reportedly provides a shuttle service to their beach club several times a day. The room: Basic, clean accommodation with tile floors (nice on account of the sand), shower, free beach towels, locked safe available for 1USD/day extra charge, and a nice porch with a couple of chairs. Get some mosquito repellent! No room phone. Most items are well worn, but the service staff is fast and courteous. To give you an idea, some towels are frayed, but the maids are ga-ga creative with the towel displays (swan, kissing swans, hearts, water-lily and even a baby shape on New Year's Eve). The food: We like to sample diverse, local food, and we'd rather pay more and eat out, than try an all-inclusive program. Nevertheless, the "reservation hand-over" from Illusion threw in free breakfast buffets which were OK (scrambled eggs, omelettes to order, fried plantaines, fresh fruit, waffles etc), though repetitious to tears after a few days, as expected. The crowd: El Tukan seems to be popular with several European travel agencies, hence an international, reasonably well-behaved, beach-bound crowd. On the other hand, we were thrilled to see many Latin Americans guests at the breakfast tables. Overall, not a bad place.

HotelInfo.Name: El Tukan
HotelInfo.Address: 5a Avenida Norte, Entre 14 y 16, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
